title: Placeholder source builds for PyPI
body_html:
Current status:

  • pip install torch: tries to install v0.1.2 but dies with ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env
  • pip install pytorch: tries to install v0.1 but dies with ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env

As discussed at #707 (comment), I think it would be nice if the PyPI package threw a more helpful error.

I think the simplest thing to do is upload a source distribution which throws a RuntimeError.

If you agree, anyone with permissions to push to PyPI can use this branch:
https://github.com/lukeyeager/pytorch/tree/tmp-pypi-upload

And run these commands:

rm -rf dist/
PYTORCH_ALLOW_BUILD=true PYTORCH_PKG_NAME=torch   python setup.py sdist
PYTORCH_ALLOW_BUILD=true PYTORCH_PKG_NAME=pytorch python setup.py sdist
twine upload dist/*

pip install torch: tries to install v0.1.2 but dies with ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env
pip install pytorch: tries to install v0.1 but dies with ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env

As discussed at #707 (comment), I think it would be nice if the PyPI package threw a more helpful error.
I think the simplest thing to do is upload a source distribution which throws a RuntimeError.
If you agree, anyone with permissions to push to PyPI can use this branch:
https://github.com/lukeyeager/pytorch/tree/tmp-pypi-upload
And run these commands:
rm -rf dist/
PYTORCH_ALLOW_BUILD=true PYTORCH_PKG_NAME=torch   python setup.py sdist
PYTORCH_ALLOW_BUILD=true PYTORCH_PKG_NAME=pytorch python setup.py sdist
twine upload dist/*
body:
Current status:

* `pip install torch`: tries to install v0.1.2 but dies with `ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env`
* `pip install pytorch`: tries to install v0.1 but dies with `ImportError: No module named setup_helpers.env`

As discussed at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/707#issuecomment-284469744, I think it would be nice if the PyPI package threw a more helpful error.

I think the simplest thing to do is upload a source distribution which throws a `RuntimeError`.

If you agree, anyone with permissions to push to PyPI can use this branch:
https://github.com/lukeyeager/pytorch/tree/tmp-pypi-upload

And run these commands:
```sh
rm -rf dist/
PYTORCH_ALLOW_BUILD=true PYTORCH_PKG_NAME=torch   python setup.py sdist
PYTORCH_ALLOW_BUILD=true PYTORCH_PKG_NAME=pytorch python setup.py sdist
twine upload dist/*
```
